config.question: Which of the following statements is true?

choices.content: The residents of the wealthiest nations in the world use about the same amount of energy (per capita) as the residents of the poor and medium poor nations.
Energy use in the 30 most economically developed countries is close to the energy use of the remaining 165 countries for both total energy consumed and for per capita energy consumption.
Energy use in the 30 most economically developed countries is similar to the remaining 165 countries for per capita energy consumption but much lower in total energy consumption.
Energy use in the 30 most economically developed countries is similar to the remaining 165 countries for total energy consumption but is much higher for per capita energy consumption.
Nearly all of the energy in the world is used by the 30 most wealthy nations with very little left over for anyone else.

answer5.response: When you consider that there are 165 countries remaining, is this likely to be true?

answer1.response: If per capita means per person, is this likely to be true when you consider the energy use of a person in America versus a person in sub-Saharan Africa?

answer3.response: If per capita means per person, is this likely to be true when you consider the energy use of a person in America versus a person in sub-Saharan Africa?

answer2.response: Is this true for total energy consumed AND per capita (per person) consumption?
